title: [Large-scale] Blended Instructional Design for Collaborative Learning and Educational Language Modeling: Strengthening Argumentation and Communication Competencies (Integrating Text Analysis, Composition, and Evaluation)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital tool proficiency, foundational understanding of language learning (grammar, vocabulary, reading comprehension, expression), collaborative communication experience, and elementary analytical skills for diverse text types (explanatory, argumentative, etc.)
context.additional_context: Activity-driven course focusing on immediately applicable collaborative learning strategies and language modeling techniques. Develops argument structuring, multimodal text interpretation (integrated reading/listening), and context-specific expression strategies (integrated speaking/writing). Incorporates MoCAS-based real-time feedback and assessment systems.

learning_goals: Learners can design and execute team-based argumentation activities using the Collaborative Instructional Framework (CIF), develop logical expression and critical-thinking-based communication skills, and strengthen argument structuring competencies through integrated complex text analysis (reading-listening).

Learners can use the MoCAS tool to achieve over 80% participation rates (based on attendance and activity logs) in online/offline environments for project planning, conflict resolution, and idea-sharing scenarios over two weeks, and perform effective communication (integrated speaking, writing, listening) scoring 3 or higher on each of the four-point evaluation criteria (clarity, logic, collaboration, expression) for a total of 12 or more points.

Learners can apply an educational language model based on Bloomâ€™s Taxonomy analysis level to practical tasks, enhance text analysis, organization, and evaluation competencies, and develop expression strategies for various genres (explanatory texts, argumentative texts, creative writing).

resources: Real-Time Collaboration Tools (Padlet, Google Docs, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
